multiple-choice.question: What is the author's attitude towards breaking mathematical rules?

title: Overpopulation – the human explosion explained

multiple-choice.question: What is the current rate of population growth on Earth?

options.label: A
options.text: The population has been increasing at a steady rate of 1% per year.

options.label: B
options.text: The population has been increasing at a steady rate of 2% per year.

options.label: C
options.text: The population has been increasing at a rate of 4% per year, but is slowing down.

options.label: D
options.text: The population has been increasing at a rate of 2.3% per year, but is slowing down.

multiple-choice.question: What is the demographic transition?

options.label: A
options.text: A four-step process that all countries go through, involving a population explosion and then a decline in population growth.

options.label: B
options.text: A process where countries with high birth rates and low death rates are more developed than countries with low birth rates and high death rates.

options.label: C
options.text: A process where countries with high birth rates and low death rates are less developed than countries with low birth rates and high death rates.

options.label: D
options.text: A process where countries with high birth rates and low death rates are more likely to experience population growth.

multiple-choice.question: What was the main reason for the population explosion in the UK during the 18th and 19th centuries?

options.label: A
options.text: The industrial revolution led to an increase in food production and a decrease in death rates.

options.label: B
options.text: The industrial revolution led to an increase in death rates and a decrease in birth rates.

options.label: C
options.text: The role of women in society shifted and created the conditions for their emancipation, leading to a decrease in death rates and an increase in birth rates.

options.label: D
options.text: The main reason for the population explosion was the increase in birth rates due to better living conditions.

multiple-choice.question: What is the current average number of children per woman in the world?
What is the expected future of global population growth?

options.label: A
options.text: The population will continue to grow at a rapid rate, leading to an apocalyptic prophecy.

options.label: B
options.text: The population will come to an end, and the UN forecasts that the 12th billionth human will never be born at all.

options.label: C
options.text: The population will stabilize at a certain level, but will not continue to grow.

options.label: D
options.text: The population will decline due to a decrease in birth rates and an increase in death rates.

multiple-choice.question: What is the percentage of people living in extreme poverty today?

options.label: D
options.text: The percentage of people living in extreme poverty has never been as low as today.

multiple-choice.question: What is the expected increase in the number of people with a higher education in the future?

options.label: A
options.text: The number of people with a higher education will decrease by 10%.

options.label: B
options.text: The number of people with a higher education will increase by 10%.

options.label: C
options.text: The number of people with a higher education will increase tenfold.

options.label: D
options.text: The number of people with a higher education will remain the same.

multiple-choice.question: What is the role of countries who used to be in need in the future?

options.label: A
options.text: They will continue to be in need and will not contribute to the development of other countries.

options.label: B
options.text: They will become more developed and will help advance development instead.

options.label: C
options.text: They will remain the same and will not change their role.

options.label: D
options.text: They will decline and will not be able to contribute to the development of other countries.

multiple-choice.question: What is the expected outcome of population growth in the future?

options.label: A
options.text: It will lead to an apocalyptic prophecy and the end of the world.

options.label: B
options.text: It will lead to a decline in the standard of living and an increase in poverty.

options.label: C
options.text: It will lead to an increase in the number of people able to advance our species.

options.label: D
options.text: It will lead to a decrease in the number of people able to advance our species.

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the collaboration that made this video possible?

options.label: D
options.text: A collaboration with Max Roser and ourworldindata

title: The death of bees explained

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the most important pillars that human society is built upon?

options.label: A

options.label: C

What is one of the most widely used insecticides in the world?

options.label: B

options.label: C

title: You won't believe your eyes

multiple-choice.question: What is the experiment that Destin is doing in this video?

options.label: A
options.text: He is testing the limits of human vision by looking at a black and white image.

options.label: B
options.text: He is trying to invert the colors of a picture and see if people can believe their eyes.

options.label: C
options.text: He is demonstrating the concept of persistence of vision using a high-speed camera.

options.label: D
options.text: He is studying the effects of color on the human brain.

multiple-choice.question: What is persistence of vision?

options.label: A
options.text: It is the ability of the eye to see in low light conditions.

options.label: B
options.text: It is the delay time between when the LED is illuminated and when the eye registers the light.

options.label: C
options.text: It is the eye's ability to average what it sees over a short period of time.

options.label: D
options.text: It is the process by which the brain interprets visual information.

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the device that Greg has created?
What is the delay time between when the LED is illuminated and when the eye registers the light?
What is the name of the expert that Destin interviews in this video?
What is the name of the university where Dr. Anstis works?
What is the trade-off relationship that the eye has between time resolution and sensitivity to light?

options.label: A
options.text: The eye can only see in low light conditions if it has a high time resolution.

options.label: B
options.text: The eye can only see in high light conditions if it has a low time resolution.

options.label: C
options.text: The eye can trade off time resolution against sensitivity to light.

options.label: D
options.text: The eye can only see in color if it has a high time resolution.

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the project that Destin is working on at the end of the video?
How does the eye's persistence of vision affect the way we see the world?

options.label: A
options.text: It makes the world appear more blurry.

options.label: B
options.text: It makes the world appear more detailed.

options.label: C
options.text: It smooths out the world and makes it appear more uniform.

options.label: D
options.text: It makes the world appear more colorful.

multiple-choice.question: What is the frame rate of the video that Destin is showing at the end of the video?

title: Why are fish fish-shaped? - Lauren Sallan

multiple-choice.question: What is unique about the way a sailfish can move through the water?

options.label: B
options.text: It can stick up its dorsal fin like a brake, grinding to a dead halt.

options.label: C
options.text: It can only swim at night.

options.label: D
options.text: It can only swim in shallow water.

multiple-choice.question: What percentage of fish species use body and caudal fin driven motion?

options.label: A
options.text: They use their dorsal fin to propel themselves.

options.label: B
options.text: They use their entire body to generate a wave-like motion.

options.label: D
options.text: They only swim in shallow water.

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the group of fish that rely on median and paired fin motion?

options.label: A
options.text: Body and caudal fin driven motion

multiple-choice.question: What is unique about the way rays move through the water?

options.label: A
options.text: They use their dorsal fin to propel themselves.

options.label: B
options.text: They use their pectoral fins to lift themselves off the sea floor.

options.label: D
options.text: They only swim in shallow water.

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the fish that lack tails and move around slowly by beating their median fins?

options.label: A
options.text: Body and caudal fin driven motion

multiple-choice.question: What is unique about the way seahorses move through the water?

options.label: A

options.label: D
options.text: They only swim in shallow water.

multiple-choice.question: What is the survival tactic called when an animal appears to be dead in order to avoid being attacked by a predator?
What is the name of the ancient Greek deity of death?

title: Stay in - or leave - a relationship?

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the most consequential and painful decisions that many people have to make?

options.label: B
options.text: Deciding whether to stay or leave a relationship.

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the factors that can influence a person's decision to stay or leave a relationship?

options.label: A
options.text: The state of their friends' relationships.

options.label: C
options.text: What films or novels they've been exposed to.

multiple-choice.question: Historically, what were some of the external sanctions that made it harder for people to leave a relationship?

options.label: A
options.text: Religions would insist that god blessed unions and would be furious that they're being torn asunder.

options.label: B
options.text: Society strongly disapproved of breakups and cast separating parties into decades of ignominy and shame.

options.label: C
options.text: Psychologists would explain that children would be deeply and permanently scarred by any termination in their parents' relationship.

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the questions that a person might ask themselves when deciding whether to stay or leave a relationship?

options.label: A
options.text: How much of our unhappiness can be tightly attributed to this particular partner?

options.label: B
options.text: How much money we have in savings.

options.label: C
options.text: What are the chances of finding someone else?

options.label: D
options.text: How many years we've been together.

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the ways that a person might be contributing to the discord in their relationship?

options.label: A
options.text: Being difficult to get along with.

options.label: B
options.text: Not being able to afford a new car.

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the things that a person might consider when thinking about leaving a relationship?

options.label: A
options.text: The risk of achieving no more than exchanging a familiar kind of unhappiness for a new and more complex variety of unhappiness.

options.label: B
options.text: The possibility of finding someone else.

options.label: C
options.text: The potential for a bigger house.

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the questions that a person might ask themselves when thinking about leaving a relationship?

options.label: A
options.text: Am I ready to face the risk of perhaps achieving no more than exchanging a familiar kind of unhappiness for a new and more complex variety of unhappiness?

options.label: B
options.text: Am I ready to move to a new city?

options.label: C
options.text: Am I ready to start a new career?

options.label: D
options.text: Am I ready to get married.

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the things that a person might do when deciding whether to stay or leave a relationship?

options.label: A
options.text: Try to have another conversation with their partner in which they don't accuse them of mendacity.

options.label: B
options.text: Go out and find someone else.

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the questions that a person might ask themselves when thinking about leaving a relationship?

options.label: A
options.text: How normal is it for any couple to have great sex after twenty-two months?

options.label: B
options.text: How normal is it for any couple to have great sex after one year?

options.label: C
options.text: How normal is it for any couple to have great sex after five years?

options.label: D
options.text: How normal is it for any couple to have great sex after ten years.

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the things that a person might do if they still have the impulse to leave a relationship?

options.label: A
options.text: Stay in the relationship and try to work things out.

options.label: B
options.text: Go out and find someone else.

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: D
